contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. It can be stated clearly that they were taken to Babylon. Alternate translation: "when the army of Babylon took the people of Jerusalem away as prisoners" or "when the army of Babylon took the people of Jerusalem as prisoners to Babylon" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: when the people of Jerusalem were taken away as prisoners

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "the land where no one had sown seed" or "the land where no food was growing" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the land that was not sown

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They have destroyed Israel's cities and now no one lives in them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: His cities are destroyed without any inhabitants

contextId.occurrenceNote: If they found people in an act of burglary, this might have been an excuse for killing them. But the people that they murdered were innocent. This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "You did not discover these people stealing things" or "But you killed them even though they were not even stealing anything" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: These people were not discovered in acts of burglary

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so they will not help you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so you will not be helped by them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "So I withheld the showers from you" or "So I prevented the rains from falling" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: So the showers have been withheld

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People hear a noise" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: A voice is heard

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "cause the people in Jerusalem to hear it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: let it be heard in Jerusalem

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will say" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will be said

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for they will devastate us" or "for they will destroy us all" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: for we will be devastated

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people hear about the disaster that is coming from Ephraim" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the coming disaster is heard from the mountains of Ephraim

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Enemies have suddenly destroyed my tents" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Suddenly my tents are destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "So the army of that nation will eat the food that you expected to harvest" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: So your harvest will be consumed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed in active from. Alternate translation: "Let those in Judah hear it" or "announce it in Judah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: let it be heard in Judah

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "For I have found wicked men among my people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For wicked men are found with my people

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I hear violence and disorder in her" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Violence and disorder are heard within her

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Because enemies will capture every man with his wife" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For every man will be taken away with his wife

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Their houses will become the possession of other people" or "There people will take their houses" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Their houses will be turned over to others

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You will continue to refine them" or "You will continue to try to purify them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The refining continues among them

contextId.occurrenceNote: God speaks of Israel continuing to be evil as if they were silver and the impurities remained in the silver. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "because the evil remains" or "the impurities remain" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: because the evil is not removed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People will say about the people of Israel, 'They are rejected silver,' for" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They will be called rejected silver, for

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh speaks of truth as if it was something the people could destroy and stop saying. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The people destroy truth and cut it off from their mouths" or "The people tell only lies" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: Truth is destroyed and cut off from their mouths

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people will no longer call it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will no longer be called

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "No one will gather their bones or bury them again" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The bones will not be gathered or buried again

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "The people of Dan hear the snorting of his stallions" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The snorting of his stallions is heard from Dan

contextId.occurrenceNote: Jeremiah tells what the people of Judah are saying. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "But Yahweh has not saved us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: But we have not been saved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom the enemy has killed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who have been killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will sing a funeral song" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a funeral song will be sung

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Because someone has burned the meadows and pastures" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For they are burned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Both "perished" and "been ruined" describe the land being ruined. Alternate translation: "is the land ruined" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])
contextId.glQuote: has the land perished and been destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the people of Zion wailing loudly and can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The people of Zion are crying loudly, saying" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For the sound of wailing is heard in Zion

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "the nations" refer to the people who live in them. This can be written in active form. Alternate translation: "for the people of the nations are afraid of the strange things they see in the sky" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: for the nations are dismayed by these

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people have to carry them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they have to be carried

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Also, the refiners are represented here by their "hands" because they do their work with their hands. Alternate translation: "gold from Uphaz that skilled craftsmen and refiners have made" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: gold from Uphaz made by artificers, the hands of refiners

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Every metalworker's idols put him to shame" or "As for every metalworker, his idols shame him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Every metalworker is put to shame by his idols

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "My enemy has devastated my tent" or "Our enemy has destroyed our tent" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: My tent is devastated

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "and their enemies have scattered all their flock" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all their flock has been scattered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will curse anyone" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Cursed is anyone

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "There is a conspiracy" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: A conspiracy has been discovered

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "turned to" is an idiom that means to start doing something. Alternate translation: "They have returned to committing the same iniquities as their earliest ancestors committed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They have turned to the iniquities of their earliest ancestors

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "but their gods will certainly not save them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: but they will certainly not be saved by them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "it will break off your branches" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: its branches will be broken

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that my enemies were leading to a butcher" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: being led to a butcher

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people will no longer remember his name" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: his name will be no longer remembered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will leave none of them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: None of them will be left

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The animals and the birds are gone" or "The animals and the birds have all died" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The animals and the birds have been taken away

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "All the land is desolate" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: All the land has been made desolate

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Every wineskin should be full of wine ... every wineskin should be full of wine" or "Every wine jar should be full of wine ... every wine jar should be full of wine" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Every jar will be filled with wine ... every jar will be filled with wine

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for enemies have captured Yahweh's flock" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: for Yahweh's flock has been taken captive

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Your enemies will shut the cities in the Negev up" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The cities in the Negev will be shut up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. This speaks of the people being Yahweh's people by saying that his name is over them. Alternate translation: "we bear your name" or "we are your people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: your name is called over us

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. This means that whole families will die and people will throw their bodies into the streets instead of burying them. Alternate translation: "Then the people to whom they prophesied will die by famine and sword and people will throw their bodies into the streets of Jerusalem" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Then the people to whom they prophesied will be thrown out in the streets of Jerusalem because of famine and sword

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Also, here the "sword" represents war. Alternate translation: "who died by the sword" or "who died in war" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: who were killed by the sword

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be written in active form. Alternate translation: "all of the sins you have committed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all your sins committed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I have heard your message" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Your words have been found

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "No one will mourn for them or bury them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They will not be mourned or buried

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "No one will bury them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They will not be buried

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "when people will no longer say" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when it will no longer be said

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "they" may refer either to the people or to their actions. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they cannot hide from me" or "they cannot hide their ways from me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they cannot be hidden from before me

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "Judah" represents the people of Judah. This may be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone has written the sin of Judah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The sin of Judah is written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This may be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone has engraved it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It is engraved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will curse any person who trusts in mankind" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The person who trusts in mankind is accursed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you will write in the dust those in the land who turn away from you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those in the land who turn away from you will be written in the earth

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you really will have healed me ... you really will have rescued me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I will be healed ... I will be rescued

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I made them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They were made

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Bring shame on my pursuers, but do not bring shame on me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May my pursuers be ashamed, but do not let me be ashamed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people will inhabit this city forever" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: this city will be inhabited forever

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people cannot put it out" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it cannot be put out

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "spoiled" means that something about the pot made the potter unhappy. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the pot that the potter was making with his hands was not good" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the pot he was making from the clay was spoiled in the potter's hand

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "a distressed shout" can be translated with a verbal phrase. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Let people hear a distressed shout" or "Let people hear others shout in distress" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Let a distressed shout be heard

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "let people overthrow them in your presence" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: let them be overthrown before you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people will no longer call this place" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: this place will no longer be called

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "because their enemies and those who are seeking their lives have brought anguish upon them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: and in the anguish brought on them by their enemies and the ones seeking their lives

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one can repair it again" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it could not be repaired again

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "There, people will bury you and all of your loved ones to whom you prophesied deceitful things" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: You and all of your loved ones to whom you prophesied deceitful things will be buried there

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you deceived me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I was deceived

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Perhaps we can trick him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Perhaps he can be tricked

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will bring great shame upon them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They will be greatly ashamed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people will never forget it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will never be forgotten

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Curse the day I was born" or "Let people curse the day when I was born" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Let the day when I was born be cursed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Do not bless the day that my mother bore me" or "Do not let people bless the day that my mother bore me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Do not let the day that my mother bore me be blessed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Curse the man who informed my father" or "Let people curse the man who informed my father" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Let the man who informed my father be cursed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I have given it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It has been given

contextId.occurrenceNote: The meaning of the Hebrew is not clear. This can be stated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) "they will greatly pity you" or 2) "you will groan greatly." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: how you will be pitied

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I have made it possible for the ones seeking your life to capture you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I have given you to the hand of the ones seeking your life

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "He will rescue Judah from their enemies" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Judah will be rescued

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that will last forever" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that will not be forgotten

contextId.occurrenceNote: These can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one could eat them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they could not be eaten

contextId.occurrenceNote: These can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one could eat them .. no one can eat them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they cannot be eaten

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "everything that Jeremiah has written in this book" or "everything that one has written in this book" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: everything written in this book

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "those whom Yahweh killed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those killed by Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one will mourn them, gather them, or bury them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they will not be mourned, gathered, or buried

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be put into active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will devastate the peaceful pastures because of he extremely angry" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the peaceful pastures will be devastated because of Yahweh's fierce anger

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "People are bringing back all the gold items that they took from Yahweh's temple!" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The objects belonging to Yahweh's house are being returned from Babylon now!

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "People will bring them to Babylon" or "I will bring them to Babylon" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They will be brought to Babylon

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom I sent" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who were sent

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "then you will know that he is indeed a true prophet and that Yahweh has sent him out" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: then it will be known that he is indeed a prophet sent out by Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "the yoke that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has imposed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the yoke imposed by Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "I sent you into exile" or "I sent you to be exiles" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I caused you to be exiled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the captives of Judah in Babylon will say a curse about these persons" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a curse will be spoken about these persons by all the captives of Judah in Babylon

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. You may need to make explicit that the city they will build will be Jerusalem. Alternate translation: "Then they will rebuild Jerusalem on its ruins" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Then a city will be built on the heap of ruins

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "so that no one will humble them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so they will not be humbled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will establish them as a people before me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: their assembly will be established before me

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh purposefully repeats the idea that he will build Israel to emphasize it. If your language can only use active verbs and has some other way to emphasize the idea, you may want to use it here. Alternate translation: "I will build you up again. Remember this: I will build you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-parallelism]])
contextId.glQuote: I will build you up again so you will be built

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "Cause everyone to hear your praise" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Let praise be heard

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "I hear a voice in Ramah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: A voice is heard in Ramah

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "She will not let anyone comfort her, for her children are dead" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: She refuses to be comforted over them, for they live no longer

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone can dig all the way down to the earth's foundation" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the earth's foundation below can be discovered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "they will rebuild the city for me" or "I will have them rebuild the city" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the city will be rebuilt for me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "They will set apart the whole valley ... for me" or "I will have them make the whole valley ... holy for me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The whole valley ... will be set apart for Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "they were keeping Jeremiah as a prisoner" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Jeremiah the prophet was imprisoned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "that I sealed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that was sealed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "The people of Israel will buy houses, vineyards and fields again in this land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Houses, fields, and vineyards will again be bought in this land

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "I am giving this city" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: this city is being given

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "name" represents Yahweh. This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "the house that belongs to me" or "the building in which they worship me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: the house that is called by my name

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "Then people will buy fields in this land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Then fields will be bought in this land

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) the people tore the houses down to make walls to defend against the Chaldeans. Alternate translation: "that the people have torn down to defend against the siege ramps and the sword" or 2) Alternate translation: "the houses that the Chaldeans have torn down to make siege ramps so they can make war" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that are torn down because of the siege ramps and the sword

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will save Judah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Judah will be saved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "the Babylonians will certainly seize you and give you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will certainly be seized and given

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "the house that belongs to me" or "the building in which they worship me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive figs-metonymy]] and
contextId.glQuote: the house that is called by my name

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The sons of Jonadab son of Rekab have observed their father's command to not drink wine" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The words of Jonadab son of Rekab that he gave to his sons as a command, not to drink any wine, have been observed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "people will throw your dead body outside" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: your corpse will be thrown out

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "Furthermore, Jeremiah and Baruch added to this scroll many more words which were similar to the words that had been in the first scroll" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Furthermore, many other similar words were added to this scroll

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "because no one had put him in prison" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: for he had not yet been put in prison

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the officials put Jeremiah into a room that was under the ground" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Jeremiah was put into an underground cell

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "His servants also gave Jeremiah a loaf of bread" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: A loaf of bread was given him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "Anyone staying in this city will die by sword, famine, and plague" or "I will kill anyone staying in this city with sword, famine, and plague" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Anyone staying in this city will be killed by sword, famine, and plague

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "the Babylonian army will not burn this city" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: this city will not be burned

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "hand" is a metonym for the power or control that the hand exercises. This can be translated in active form. See how similar words are translated in [Jeremiah 38:2](../38/02.md). Alternate translation: "I will allow the Chaldeans to conquer this city" or "I will allow the Chaldeans to do whatever they want with this city" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: this city will be given into the hand of the Chaldeans

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "hand" is a metonym for the power or control that the hand exercises. This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "the Chaldeans might put me under the control of the people of Judah who have deserted" or "the Chaldeans might allow the people of Judah who have deserted to do whatever they want with me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: I might be given over into their hand

contextId.occurrenceNote: The reader should understand that the officials will take these women as slaves. Alternate translation: "Soldiers will bring all the women who are left ... out to the officials of the king of Babylon" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: All the women who are left ... will be brought out to the officials of the king of Babylon

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "Your friends have deceived you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: You have been deceived by your friends

contextId.occurrenceNote: The reader should understand that the officials will take these people as slaves. Alternate translation: "Soldiers will bring your wives and children out to the Chaldeans" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For all of your wives and children will be brought out to the Chaldeans

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "until the day that the Babylonian army captured Jerusalem" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: until the day Jerusalem was captured

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom the soldiers were about to take to Babylon as exiles" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who were being carried into exile to Babylon

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "those whom the enemy soldiers had not sent to Babylon" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those who had not been exiled to Babylon

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "where the Babylonians had driven them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: where they had been scattered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "who have come to you" or "whom Yahweh has brought to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that has been gathered to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "to have the Chaldeans scatter them" or "to flee away to many different lands" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to be scattered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "allow the Chaldeans to destroy the remnant of Judah" or "and allow the remnant of Judah to perish" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: the remnant of Judah destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "also the Chaldean soldiers there" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the Chaldean fighting men found there

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom they had rescued" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who had been rescued

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom they had rescued at Gibeon" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who had been rescued at Gibeon

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "where Yahweh had scattered them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: where they had been scattered

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract noun "death" can be stated as "die." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Everyone will die whom I have decided must die" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Anyone who is assigned to death will be given to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The Babylonians will take everyone captive whom I have decided must go into captivity" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Anyone who is assigned to captivity will be taken captive

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you will cause me to destroy you" or "you will destroy yourselves" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will be destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Then we will have plenty of food" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Then we will be filled with food

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one will be able to count them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: unable to be counted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Then after this, people will live in Egypt again" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Then after this Egypt will be inhabited

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The enemy army has destroyed Moab" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Moab has been destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the enemy army will also capture you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you also will be captured

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The enemy army will devastate Moab and attack its cities" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Moab will be devastated and its cities attacked

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that the enemy army has devastated Moab" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that Moab has been devastated

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh punishing the people of the hill country and cities of Moab is spoken of as if punishment were something that could travel and arrive in a place. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will punish the people of the hill country, of Holon ... Mephaath" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: punishment has come to the hill country, to Holon ... Mephaath

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The enemy has captured Kerioth and seized its strongholds" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Kerioth has been captured, and its strongholds have been seized

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "So the enemy will destroy the people of Moab" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: So Moab will be destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the enemy army has taken your sons and daughters as captives" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: your sons are taken as captives and your daughters into captivity

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for your enemies will devastate Ai" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: for Ai will be devastated

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh has sent out a messenger" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a messenger has been sent out

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "and people despise you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: despised by people

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom I will choose" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who will be chosen

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People at the Sea of Reeds will hear the people of Edom crying" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The sound of distressed shouts is heard at the Sea of Reeds

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Your soldiers will take their flocks, tent curtains, and all of their equipment" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Their tents and their flocks will be taken, along with their tent curtains and all of their equipment

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "your soldiers will take their camels from them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: their camels will be led away from them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This states that the covenant will be obeyed forever. It can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that no one will forget" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that will not be forgotten

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "These nations will capture Babylon" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Babylon will be captured from there

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the nations have torn down her walls" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: her walls are torn down

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will look for iniquity in the people of Israel, but will not find any" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: iniquity will be looked for in Israel, but none will be found

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I have captured you ... I found you and captured you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you were taken ... You were found and captured

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will destroy all her fighting men" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all her fighting men will be destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The Babylonians are oppressing the people of Israel and Judah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The people of Israel are oppressed, together with the people of Judah

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "enemy soldiers will plunder them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they will be plundered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one will live in her" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: she will not be lived in

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom I will choose" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who will be chosen

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "those whom the attackers kill" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those who are killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will destroy Babylon" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Babylon will ... be destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "perhaps Yahweh can heal her" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: perhaps she can be healed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "we have not been able to heal her" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: she is not healed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Every metalworker's idols put him to shame" or "As for every metalworker, his idols shame him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Every metalworker is put to shame by his idols

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "the enemies have overcome the whole city" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: his city has been taken

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "the enemies have taken control of all the fords over the river" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the fords over the river are seized

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "how" here shows that something that people thought was impossible has happened. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "We never thought that enemies could capture Babylon, but they have captured her ... We never thought that Babylon could become a ruined place, but it has become a ruined place" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: How Babylon has been captured ... How Babylon has become a ruined place

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "Its roaring waves have covered her" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: She is covered with its roaring waves

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "when you hear the news that is in the land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the news that is heard in the land

contextId.occurrenceNote: This phrase can be changed to have an active verb. Alternate translation: "her enemies have captured her warriors" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: her warriors have been captured

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "The invaders willl completely demolish the thick walls of Babylon" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The thick walls of Babylon will be completely demolished

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "they will burn her high gates" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: her high gates will be burned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "they will burn up everything that the nations try to do for her" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: everything ... will be burned up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "So they besieged the city" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: So the city was besieged

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "the Babylonians broke through the wall around the city" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the city was broken into

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) "the Chaldeans scattered his entire army" or 2) "all of his soldiers ran away in different directions." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: All his army was scattered
